SENT.plain: CONTEXT: Circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) is a promising biomarker in cancer
MATERIALS AND METHODS: We generated xenograft models of cancer and detected ctDNA in plasma by qRCR targeting human AluJ sequences
RESULTS: Our assay reached single cell sensitivity in vitro and a correlation between ctDNA amount and tumor size was observed in vivo
Treatment with a mitogen activated protein kinase kinase (MEK)-inhibitor (BAY 869766) reduced ctDNA levels
Using this assay, we also confirmed that high levels of cell-free DNA are found in cancer patients compared to healthy individuals
DISCUSSION AND CONCLUSION: We show that ctDNA may be useful biomarker for monitoring tumor growth and treatment response
